name: Arnold Shoulder Press
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on a bench or chair with your back straight and core engaged.

2. Lean back slightly so that you are balanced on the edge of the seat, keeping your body at an angle to the ground.

3. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing away from your body.

4. Keeping your arms straight, press the dumbbells directly upwards, engaging your shoulder muscles and extending your arms fully.

5. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, keeping control throughout the movement.

6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on a smooth motion and controlled descent.

7. Avoid swinging or jerking the weights, ensuring that your shoulder muscles remain engaged throughout the exercise.
short_summary: The Arnold Shoulder Press is an upper body exercise that isolates and strengthens the shoulders while targeting surrounding muscle groups.
